Got to go, this Q&A is over. Thanks for your questions! I really enjoyed this chat. Benoît Cœuré #askECB https://t.co/tSJTVrFh7R
. @jmackin2 also see this chart /BC #askECB https://t.co/MBtWwcqgRY
. @notayesmansecon Hear it didn't go so well. But ask @ECB_cricket /BC #askECB
.@mheger78 Decision on sec lending helps ensure smooth functioning of repo markets. Gov Council decision. We'll monitor/BC #askECB
.@jmackin2 Lending rates to companies have fallen by >100bp since June 2014 & even more for SMEs. This clearly supports investment /BC
. @saeedamenfx I gave a speech about exactly this topic, see https://t.co/LDknpa1eHf /BC #AskECB
.@saeedamenfx Pressure exists but banks also profit from lower funding costs and better credit quality /BC #AskECB https://t.co/vxFgY1zogB
.@stanjourdan "Helicopter money" not a well defined concept but likely to blur the line with fiscal policy. Never discussed. /BC #askECB
Happening now: ECB's Twitter Q&A with Board member Benoît Cœuré Follow #askECB
.@macrocredit Increased T2 balances reflect APP settlement in financial centres and APP-induced portfolio adjustments. No capital flight/BC
.@fwred Removal of floor an effective tool to ensure smooth and durable implementation. Issue(r) limits not the preferred option/BC #askECB
. @rafaminos Deflation risks largely disappeared but continued stimulus needed. Hence extension by 9 months and 540bn euros /BC #askECB
. @macro_times Just the right amount of stimulus to bring inflation back towards 2% /BC #askECB

ECB adjusts parameters of its asset purchase programme (APP) https://t.co/4esJ0jtn0G
Draghi: Cash will be accepted as collateral for securities lending
Draghi: Many reforms undertaken when rates were already low. Many others have nothing to do with low rates.
Draghi: Easy monetary conditions should help undertake structural reforms
Draghi: Trust is one condition to progress towards a more perfect monetary union. But countries need to converge too.
Draghi: Our mandate is to ensure the price stability objective for the whole of the euro area
Draghi: Fiscal policies should respect the SGP. It is an anchor of stability and credibility.
Draghi: The ECB is going to stay in the market and to exert pressure on market prices, without distorting them
Draghi: Countries that need reform have to undertake them regardless of what is the general political uncertainty
Draghi: Central banks should keep a steady hand
Draghi: The intention of our monetary policy decisions is to maintain monetary accommodation in place
Draghi: The Governing Council acting in a pragmatic and flexible way to cope with risks
Draghi: There is no question about tapering. Tapering has not been discussed today.
Draghi: The risk of deflation has largely disappeared but uncertainty prevails everywhere
Draghi: Purchases below deposit rate is an option, not a necessity
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/ytJVZZKDhw
Draghi: Measures taken received a very broad consensus in the Governing Council
Draghi: Fiscal policies should also support the economic recovery, while remaining in compliance with the fiscal rules of the EU
Draghi: Structural reforms are necessary in all euro area countries
Draghi: To reap full benefits from our measures other policy areas must contribute much more decisively at national and European level
Draghi: Eurosystem staff projections: HICP at 0.2% in 2016 (0.2% in Sept), 1.3% in 2017 (1.2%), 1.5% in 2018 (1.6%) and 1.7% in 2019
Draghi: Eurosystem staff projections: GDP increase by 1.7% in 2016 (1.7% in Sept) and 1.7% in 2017 (1.6%), 1.6% in 2018 (1.6%), 1.6% in 2019
Draghi: ECB expects economic expansion to proceed at a moderate but firming pace
Draghi: Calibration reflects moderate but firming recovery of the euro area economy and still subdued underlying inflationary pressures
Draghi: Extension of purchases over longer horizon gives more sustained market presence and more lasting transmission of stimulus measures
Draghi: APP’s extension preserves very substantial monetary accommodation
Draghi: Key ECB rates expected to remain at present or lower levels for extended period of time well past horizon of net asset purchases
Draghi: Purchases of securities under APP with yield below deposit facility rate will be permitted to extent necessary
Draghi: Maturity range of PSPP to be broadened by decreasing minimum remaining maturity for eligible securities from two years to one year
Draghi: Net purchases made alongside reinvestments of the principal payments from maturing securities purchased under the APP
Draghi: If outlook less favourable or financing conditions inconsistent with inflation aim, ECB intends to increase size/duration of APP
Draghi: From April 2017, ECB net asset purchases to continue at monthly pace of €60 bn until end December 2017, or beyond, if necessary
